channel.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
channel.description:
Hi,
Since I only recently obtained access to this part of the forums from mopar I have not had a chance to post any code.
I am not sure if you guys already have loaders, modifiers, etc... I dare say you do. But regardless here is a loader client hacker I wrote.
http://www.sythe.org/syloader.zip
You will need the bcel libraries to use it. The test class has example use. To add new client patches open hackClientGen and locate the '// Todo: add patches here' line. An example is given.
This loader works in the following way: Downloads the client jar and decompresses it in memory. Patches each class using bcel according to your patch calls. Loads the patched classes into a custom class loader. Executes 'client' using the custom class loader.
It was nessesary to null all functionality of the system security manager to make this work correctly. If anyone knows a better work around for this problem please inform me.
I hope this is of some use to someone.

item.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

[quote=“ruler, post:40, topic:13566”]securitymanager will be different.
You have to keep in mind jagex wont go after things that vary from platform to platform.
Also a funny ban appeal would involve saying that one uses a touch screen monitor instead of a mouse.[/quote]

If they were intelligent, they wouldn’t take that into consideration because it should lead them to ask you why it matters if you are using a touch screen or a mouse. Also, it should lead them to ask you WHY you chose to use that particular argument for a ban appeal. It wouldn’t be possible for anyone to know of any potential limitations in their bot discovery without having disassembled their code. Regardless, even a touch screen monitor generates much more mouse activity than some mediocre bot systems.

Read full topic

item.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Nerice:

Dont use it myself, so looked to me like it was just calling his, so it calls thiers, then calls the appletstub method? I just looked and it says it acts like the interface between the envirement, will have to look deeper into it I guess.

Basically like that, when an applet is loaded in a browser the browser uses appletstub just like that class does, so technically the client shouldn’t be able to tell the difference bewtween a browser and an appletstub at all. Of course the securitymanager could be different, but I think thats it.

Read full topic

item.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Nerice, post:36, topic:13566”]It works, didnt try to log in though. It loads at least that I know of.

If it became public they could make it detectable very easy. pc.K and pc.j is never incremented. :\

Have heard of people using appletstub, not sure how many do it this same way but they can find out how many times a method of thiers has been run (I know… everone knows), gotta run them, or at least increment thier counters for them in case they decide to check that variable. They see getCodeBase and getDocumentBase has never ran, errr? We have a problem Houston.[/quote]

I just had time to compile it once, and I get a runtime error, Ill have to look at it again if it works for you though.

about the getCodeBase and getDocumentBase though, I had a hard time understanding how appletstub worked at first too, but you are not overriding those two methods in client.java (or whatever class jagex sticks them in now) you are simply overriding those in appletstub, which in turn gets called by jagex’s two methods of the same name, the exact same thing happens when your browser runs the applet. So at least in that way it is not detectable.

Read full topic

item.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“Sythe, post:29, topic:13566”]No offense you guys but three points:
a) I don’t need to steal code; I am in the middle of a software engineering degree and am perfectly capable of writing my own. That said, what would be the point of posting this code if I had gotten it elsewhere… its not even generic code; so watch those accusations mate.
b) ARGA looks and sounds like a piece of crap (from the previews). In addition, all the people working on it appear to be novices. You didn’t know to use a custom class loader? You didn’t know how to setup a fake applet stub? This stuff is pretty basic.
c) Pplsuqbawlz has not told you anything unique or new. These ideas have been around for years and you could have asked anyone. Hes not your god, or even your friend. You would be wise to stay far away from him in future. He is a social engineer.[/quote]

I hadnt seen it anywhere else before. Yes it is very very basic stuff, we just didnt think of it ;).

“a) I don’t need to steal code; I am in the middle of a software engineering degree and am perfectly capable of writing my own. That said, what would be the point of posting this code if I had gotten it elsewhere… its not even generic code; so watch those accusations mate.”

I was regarding ScarScape :). Not the loader. Yes the loader is your code.

“Because using the original loader is a no-no.”

I mean haxing the loader, sorry, bad choice of words

"You didn’t know to use a custom class loader? "

We do use a custom class loader.

Sythe as i have said i dont know enough to comment fully and it would be wrongly for me to do so on the topic of scarscape and everything else. I am only going on what i have heard and i do apologise if i was incorrect.

Read full topic
item.source: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly

item.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Even how it loads rs,
Because using the original loader is a no-no. What do you think is safer: Haxing the client with a modded loader, or haxing the loader without touching the client?

Read full topic

item.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Lets just end the whole debate right here.

  1. Pplsuqbawlz is best at one thing for sure, social engineering, he even said that was the best way to do anything once during a phone conversation with him

  2. He is at minimum a proficiant coder, no where near the “better than the proffesionals” coder that he claims to be, but he is good nonetheless.

I’m not sure if this is just a phrase from where I come from, but have you ever heard of taking somthing with a grain of salt? That means don’t take what you are told as the 100% gospel truth. It is obvious by at least his bytecode post that he has a tendancy to exagerate things, just a guessing figure would be take about 70% off from what he says and that should be near the truth, if he says he wrote 100 classes for his bot, its reasonable that he wrote near 30, and so on.

Nothing against pplsuqbawlz or anyone else, we all have our flaws, his being a tendancy to exagerate and an over-inflated ego.

Read full topic

item.title: Loader: download, bcel modify and load all on the fly
item.dc:creator: @Sythe Sythe
item.description:
@Sythe wrote:

No offense you guys but three points:
a) I don’t need to steal code; I am in the middle of a software engineering degree and am perfectly capable of writing my own. That said, what would be the point of posting this code if I had gotten it elsewhere… its not even generic code; so watch those accusations mate.
b) ARGA looks and sounds like a piece of crap (from the previews). In addition, all the people working on it appear to be novices. You didn’t know to use a custom class loader? You didn’t know how to setup a fake applet stub? This stuff is pretty basic.
c) Pplsuqbawlz has not told you anything unique or new. These ideas have been around for years and you could have asked anyone. Hes not your god, or even your friend. You would be wise to stay far away from him in future. He is a social engineer.

Read full topic
